unnormalised: Someone asked me the other day what all this "www" business is about. I remember when I first got introduced to the internet back in '98, using dial-up with a 56 kbps modem – took ages to load even a simple page! Back then, everyone had an email address with @yahoo.com or @rediffmail.com. Now, my son uses Gmail and says Yahoo is ancient.
normalised: Someone asked me the other day what all this "W-W-W" business is about. I remember when I first got introduced to the internet back in nineteen ninety eight, using dial-up with a fifty six K B P S modem – took ages to load even a simple page! Back then, everyone had an email address with at yahoo dot com or at rediffmail dot com. Now, my son uses G-mail and says Yahoo is ancient.

unnormalised: Anyway, "www" stands for World Wide Web, basically the collection of websites you see. My college professor explained it as a system of interconnected documents accessible via the internet. Think of it like a gigantic library. You need a web browser, like Chrome or Firefox, to access these pages. You type in the address (URL), which often starts with "https://", into the browser, and voila!
normalised: Anyway, "W-W-W" stands for World Wide Web, basically the collection of websites you see. My college professor explained it as a system of interconnected documents accessible via the internet. Think of it like a gigantic library. You need a web browser, like Chrome or Firefox, to access these pages. You type in the address (U-R-L), which often starts with "H-T-T-P-S colon slash slash", into the browser, and voila!

unnormalised: These days, with 4G and soon 5G from Jio and Airtel, things are much faster. People are always on their phones, scrolling through Facebook and Instagram, completely glued to social media. They don't even think about the technicalities anymore. Back in my day, understanding TCP/IP was a badge of honor! Now, kids just want to know the latest TikTok trends. How times have changed!
normalised: These days, with four G and soon five G from Jio and Airtel, things are much faster. People are always on their phones, scrolling through Facebook and Instagram, completely glued to social media. They don't even think about the technicalities anymore. Back in my day, understanding T-C-P slash I-P was a badge of honor! Now, kids just want to know the latest TikTok trends. How times have changed!
